div.p: RBG Kew, Kew correspondence, Australia, Mueller, 1858-70, f. 61.
MS black-edged; M's sister Bertha died on 7 September 1861. MS annotation by [Daniel Oliver]: 'Cabinets Shelving'. Melbourne bot. Garden
I beg to enclose bill of loading of 2 cases with dried plants, shipped to your adress pr Ship Kent this day.
This consignment comprises the following orders & genera of our normal herbarium for Mr Benthams inspection in the elaboration of his Universal Australian Flora.

note.p:
Hippocrateae 1. appears to have been inserted after the table was first completed , and the total for Case 6 not adjusted.
I n the following paragraph, Hyppocrateae has been deleted before Portulaceae.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: The whole number of fasc now sent = 107. There is a large box full yet [in]stant of Sapindaceae which will be sent ere long & finish with Portulaceae the Thalamiflorae.
